definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: How many of you believe in psycho-kinesis? Raise my hand.
sentences.chinese: 多少人相信意念驅物的？請把我的手舉起來。

sentences.english: One hand went up as the snickering diminished.
sentences.chinese: 有一隻手舉了起來，同時竊笑聲逐漸消失。

sentences.english: Grab two dumbbells of a comfortable weight, and press the weights from your chest upward.
sentences.chinese: 手舉適當重量的啞鈴，從胸部開始向上舉。

sentences.english: Swim backstroke, focusing on keeping the hands above the shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 遊仰泳，專注於保持手舉在肩。

sentences.english: Holding the umbrella, can not cover the rain pours, wanton play on the girl.
sentences.chinese: 手舉的傘，遮不住雨的傾瀉，肆意地打在女孩的身上。

sentences.english: The hero exploded the packet of gunpowder by holding it up.
sentences.chinese: 英雄手舉炸藥包引爆了炸藥。

sentences.english: A gay-rights supporter held a flag during a pride parade in Mumbai Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 一名同性戀權利支持者手舉旗幟進行遊行，孟買。

sentences.english: Would one of the TAs count, because I don't want to. Just hold your hands up.
sentences.chinese: 助教數一下吧，因爲我不想做，保持手舉着。
